intro: Hieracium schmidtii var. camarenae, commonly known as the Schmidt's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust growth habit. The plant typically features bright yellow flowers and hairy leaves, adapted to thrive in dry, open habitats. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a spreading growth pattern. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
